name: ASSOCIAZIONE DI PROMOZIONE SOCIALE FUTURO DIGITALE
goal:
The aim of the Digital Future is to Realize a model of solidarity in a new associative experience. APSFD bases its own principles on the promotion of all the actions that favor the cognitive tools inherent in the panorama of European programs , youth policy . The aim is also to create a network for the exchange of information and best practices in guidance , training, promotion of European citizenship , national and European youth policy , culture and intercultural , European integration and the digital divide. The Association's main purpose is to build new relationships between Calabrians and European institutions, pursuing the g
following goals :
a) Promotion of European policies in the region ;
b ) Active involvement of Calabrian citizens in the life of the European Union ;
c ) Promotion of European funding programs , Offered by Europe to the Local Authorities and to the private sector ;
d ) To set synergies and exchanges with other European countries;
e) To encourage young people to participate on Actively in the European Union;
f ) Improve the quality and access to mobility within the European Union in the field of training , cooperation and education;
g ) Reducing the digital divide ( digital divide ) to local and global level through the adoption and diffusion of innovative technologies (eg increase in broadband penetration ) ;
h ) To promote the responsible use of the tools of communication , information technology and telecommunications networks , in particular the Internet ;
i) Work with local educational agencies , promoting multimedia creative workshops , to bring people closer to technology ;
l) Promoting social inclusion , especially through the use of technologies , including mobile , information and communication technologies (ICT ) to facilitate and increase the participation of individuals and communities to the information society and knowledge, for the promotion of European citizenship and knowledge of opportunities and tools provided by the community itself.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Audiovisual and Media, Communication, Consumer Affairs, Culture, Development, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Enterprise, Environment, Fisheries and Aquaculture, General and Institutional Affairs, Humanitarian Aid, Information Society, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Sport, Trans-European Networks, Youth
